questions.question: I ……………………… tired.
questions.description: When feel is used to talk about reactions and opinions, it is not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: She is ……………………………. amazing woman.
questions.description: In exclamations, we use such before an adjective + plural noun.

questions.question: That was ……………………………….. kind of you.
questions.description: So is used before an adjective.

questions.question: I ………………………. this kind of treatment from him.
questions.description: Before an indirect object, wait and hope are followed by for.

questions.question: It seemed like he was wearing someone …………………………… coat.
questions.description: Else has a possessive form – else’s.

questions.question: She was ………………………. tired to walk.
questions.description: Too is not used with much before an adjective.

questions.question: This book is an ……………………………… account of the freedom struggle.
I have difficulty ……………………………. dates and numbers.
questions.description: Difficulty is followed by (in) + ing form.

questions.question: There is something ……………………………..the bed.
questions.description: We use under when something is covered by what is over it.

questions.question: I didn’t like this house ………………………., it is too small.
If my grandfather had been alive, we …………………………………… his 90th birthday in January.
